intro: Crescentia acuminata, commonly known as the sweet sop or custard apple, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caricaceae, characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces a fruit with a thick, leathery skin that encases a sweet, creamy pulp containing numerous seeds. Its growth habit includes a woody stem and it can reach heights of up to 10 meters. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its edible fruit.
